channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 2024 Met Gala: Red Carpet Roundup
item.description: See the looks from fashion’s biggest night.

item.title: Live Updates: Israeli Tanks Enter Rafah and Take Control of Border Crossing
item.description: Before the overnight assault in Gaza, Israel warned 110,000 people to evacuate and launched airstrikes against what it called Hamas targets. A military official said the scope of the operation was limited.

item.title: FDIC workplace probe finds bank regulator needs a ‘structural and cultural transformation’ to fix ‘sexualized, boys’ club environment’
item.description: The findings also recommend changes to the agency’s performance review process, workplace conduct metrics, and that an internal monitor be installed to oversee the effort.

item.title: A Week of Pomp to Project Putin’s Confidence
item.description: The Russian president’s inauguration for a fifth term and the annual Victory Day parade will highlight his grip on the country’s politics and his resolve to capture Ukraine.

item.title: U.K. Armed Forces’ Data Stolen by State-Linked Hackers, Lawmakers Say
item.description: A payroll system used by Britain’s Ministry of Defense was targeted in a significant cyberattack, senior British politicians said.

item.title: Andreessen Horowitz partner says Google is an ‘amazing example’ of employing people in ‘BS jobs’: ‘Half the white-collar staff probably does no real work’
item.description: "Those people aren't just being useless (and being coddled to think useless jobs actually matter—they don’t), but they are also taking money away from the rest of the workforce's retirement programs."

item.title: U.S. Repatriates 11 American Citizens From ISIS War Camps in Syria
item.description: The group — the largest set of Americans retrieved from the war zone — was joined by a 9-year-old noncitizen whose brother is an American.

item.title: A Week of Pomp to Project Putin’s Confidence
item.description: The Russian president’s inauguration for a fifth term and the annual Victory Day parade will highlight his grip on the country’s politics and his resolve to capture Ukraine.

item.title: Wizz Air boss regrets laying off 20% of workforce during pandemic because it hit morale
item.description: Wizz Air boss Jozsef Váradi told fatigued pilots to go "the extra mile" in 2022 as airline struggled with staff numbers.

item.title: Ozempic Is Repairing a Hole in Our Diets Created by Processed Foods
item.description: Now is our chance to rethink the centuries-old stories we’ve told about obesity and weight loss.

item.title: U.S. Repatriates 11 American Citizens From ISIS War Camps in Syria
item.description: The group — the largest set of Americans retrieved from the war zone — was joined by a 9-year-old noncitizen whose brother is an American.

item.title: Kellogg’s is letting workers clock off at 12pm on Fridays—but only if they make up the hours during the week
item.description: The $20.6 billion food manufacturer, Kellanova, said its research revealed that two-thirds of people would be willing to work harder during the rest of the week for Friday afternoons off.

item.title: Isolated From West, Putin Projects Domestic Power at Inauguration
item.description: The event for Mr. Putin, who claimed his fifth term in a rubber-stamp election, included a church service that underscored efforts to give a religious sheen to his rule.

item.title: Isolated From West, Putin Projects Domestic Power at Inauguration
item.description: The event for Mr. Putin, who claimed his fifth term in a rubber-stamp election, included a church service that underscored efforts to give a religious sheen to his rule.

item.title: Americans need more exercise—and should be able to tap FSA and HSA funds to pay for gyms, studios, and sports leagues
item.description: The PHIT Act aims to expand families' access to physical activity programs and equipment—for youth and adults alike.
